TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ThemeType extends System.Enum

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Specifies the type of theme displayed in the **Options** dialog box.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
The user can modify UserDefined themes in the workflow designer, but cannot modify Default or System themes in that context.
The **Options** dialog box appears when a user right-clicks the workflow design surface and selects **Select Custom Theme…**. The Default and System categories are listed under the **Standard Themes** header in the selection window, while the UserDefined category, which contains any themes created by the user, are listed under the **User Defined Themes** header.
Themes define the background, foreground, text, icon and other styles used to render a workflow on the workflow design surface.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ThemeType Default = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The theme settings are provided by the default workflow theme.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ThemeType System = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The theme settings are provided by the operating system.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ThemeType UserDefined = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The theme settings are provided by user-defined themes.
